text: I love their sandwiches but the Plaza is really dirty.  I'd go all the time if it was located elsewhere.  hope they open another one somewhere safer and cleaner.

Ehhh...it was just "ok" bread was hard and sandwich was dry. This was my first trying bahn mi so I had very little to compare it too, however after reading the reviews, I suspect I expected more. 

Pro's - the place is super clean! And the staff was nice. The prices are also very reasonable. 

Con's - the location leaves more to be desired and the parking lot could potentially ruin your tires so be careful. The bread was very hard and the sandwich seemed dry. 

Overall, wasn't the worst experience ever, but also wasn't the best. I will be trying the yummi bahn mi food truck next, maybe then I will have something vaguely to compare it too.

Well, I must say I was really looking forward to trying this place based on the rave reviews. However, it was very hard to find...omg! I finally located it in this raggedy strip mall...The area is pretty deserted and very rundown...POTHOLES galore! It's kinda scary over there, I wouldn't go alone just my personal preference. On to the sandwich...my sandwich bread was really over toasted and actually kind scratched the roof of my mouth in the midst of creating a zillion crumbs everywhere. The pork def had a good taste and although I was not expecting a lot of meat, I did think the amount was TOO little. One slice of that yummy pork just didn't cut it for me or my hubby.  The veggies were really good compliments and added nice crunch. I would have enjoyed more of a condiment to bring everything together as I couldn't really detect the butter/pate spread the sign said was on it (maybe due to over-toasting?). The owner was super friendly and that makes me want to visit again in spite of my not-so-great first experience...I'd prob give it another shot, one day.
A sandwich as good as Le's Banh Mi #6 will make you forget every pothole on your way to flavor heaven.

I enjoyed the banh mi sandwiches here. I ordered the bbq pork and a strawberry bubble tea. The pickled veggies were crunchy and delicious! I could've ate another half of a sandwich. My bf ordered the other pork sandwich but I enjoyed mine better. He also ordered the sugar cane drink and enjoyed it but it was too sweet for my taste. I know what do you expect from a drink just made with sugar cane! (With a touch of orange) The man running the place was a bit rude to me when I asked him a question but I would still go back to eat their sandwiches. Don't forget to bring cash no cards accepted.
Heaven on earth! Sandwiches are the best banh mi in town!

I have always said dont judge a book by its cover and this pertains to this place. The outside may look a lil rough but believe me u will not regret it. I have been looking for a banh mi place since I moved here and found this place thanks to yelp! After reading the reviews I decided to try it and I definitely did not regret it even tho my BF was a bit hesitant because of the location. He loved it! He had never tried banh mi before but I have all my life and these are great!  My bf prefers the #6 the pork banh mi but my favorite is the #7 banh mi dac biet its sooooo good! You should all go I bet you will be going back for more like we do! Also the bubble teas are good too I like the mango and bf likes the honeydew. Also a tip: bring cash because thats all they accept.

Absolutely love this place, had amazing service and delicious food! Would absolutely come back again, again, and again. 

I got the pork with jalapeños and it was super crisp and flavorful with nice crispy bread. Overall I'd give it 6 stars if I could.

Wow...what an interesting experience. I knew the food had to be good if people are willing to traverse such treacherous terrain for a sandwich. I had to swerve around craters, I mean potholes, in the parking lot and then walk through what appeared to be an abandoned mall in a third world country to reach the restaurant.

Once inside, I felt a sense of relief. The restaurant was clean and the staff were very friendly. I had the #6: a pork sandwich with pickled veggies and fresh cilantro for $3.75. OMG, what a great deal. The sandwich was simple, fresh and delicious for under four bucks. They must be making their money on sodas. My can of coke was $1. But I can't complain, the meal is the best value I've gotten for lunch in years. 

This place takes hole-in-the-wall to a whole new level and I love it! It's cash only and most people order take-out.  Add this place to your list. The food is fresh and fabulous.

Cash only, awesome bahn-mi and housemade jerky. As other reviews have pointed out, it's in a dead mall...but whatever- this place is awesome and the location isn't hurting them. Basically everything on their menu is well worth the drive and any *uncomfortable feelings*  you might have in an unfamiliar atmosphere
This place is always great! Not good, not okay but GREAT! the prices are stellar and the owners are always nice!

Their sandwich is always fresh, the bread crusty yet light and soft on the inside.  I always get the grilled pork (#6) and the pork is done just right doesn't have excess fat (the same cannot usually be said for the other banh mi places I tried).  The shop is also spotlessly clean - hence the consistent 98+ sanitation rating.

Worth the trip even if it's located in one of the worst "mall" settings in the area.
About as authentic as a Bahn Mi can get right down to the charming second world atmosphere the mall offers. Cash only. But everything is pretty cheap.

Felt like a Tarantino movie.... 

Been reading about Le's for some time and craving the amazing combination of crispy / crunchy / sweet / sour / hot and unctuousness that is Banh Mi. I heard Mr. Le had the best in town. 

Pulled into the broken down parking lot, and headed toward the entrance, half way to the door, turned around to make sure the car was locked....  I enter at the wrong side so walk through a large empty echo-y building, no sign for the place, no people, no business. I turn to the right and continue walking... past the shuttered stores with old orthopedic barcaloungers and dated travel posters, past the two  Asian gentlemen smoking cigarettes in a dimly lit doorway. I hear my own footsteps and fully expect to be relieved of the twenty I just got from the ATM. In the distance I see "Le's Sandwiches", it seems darker than it should, but  pick up the pace because I have found the place. I get to the door, it says "Closed Wednesday" I am crushed...  

Back the next day, I am rewarded, it IS the best Banh Mi in town. I get a #6, and a water. sit at one of the few tables, eventually look up and there is a table of four smiling at me. They tell me they drive 45 min from SC once a week to partake in Mr. Le's Sandwiches. #6 is so good I want more, it's so cheap I can afford more, and small enough that I can eat more, so  get a #8. I talk to Mr. Le about his bread and the finer points of rice flour vs. high gluten, then I notice he walks across the hall to the Chinese place and has his lunch delivered.

I may try that next time...
Best bahn mi sandwich s ever. My husband loves their freshly squeezed sugar cane drink its so refreshing on a hot day.

Mmmmmmmmm. Banh Mi. Not much else needs to be said but I'll say it anyway. The sandwiches are amazing and very fresh (not to mention great price). This place is tiny but clean, with only a sprinkling of tables if you plan on eating in. Don't forget to bring cash and do keep in mind that they close up sometimes for weeks at a time as it's a mom and pop so if they're on holiday it's not open. All that really doesn't matter because this is excellent banh mi so it's still 5 stars.

$4 buys you the most delicious sandwich you can imagine! 

Everything that the others rave about is TRUE. The baguettes here are chewy and fresh, the meat is savory, the vegetables are crispy and bright. These things combine to make a tasty treat that is simply sublime.

About once a week, someone at the office has a craving . . . we dispatch a volunteer and spend the afternoon rejoicing over the experience.  I just returned as an envoy to what I affectionally refer to as "Little Saigon" with eleven #6s, 3 with peppers. ;) 

Nomnomnomnomnomnomnom!

On vacation with my parents looking for a good Bahn Mi to eat. Definitely, this is the place. Location extremely run down and kind of scary. Go in the daytime, would not recommend night time. The cafe is inside the mall. Next, to the cafe is a bunch of Asian stores. As you walk in you will immediately see it. Not much to look at. But, has very good Bahn Mi. Owner really nice gentlemen. Now, the Bahn Mi, bread was extremely good. Crust just right, and soft. The Bahn Mi, was $4 under. I ordered the grill pork, topped with cilantro, carrots, daikon and some jalapeno peppers for a kick. Delicious!! I have tasted a lot of Bahn Mi, from Columbus, Chicago, LA, Houston, Toronto, and Boston. Hands down this place is really good. Great Bahn Mi!! Good Vietnamese ice or hot coffee too!! If, you can overlook the location and run down mall. Just run in quickly and get your Bahn Mi and ice coffee and run out.

If you like adventure and a great Banh Mi and want to be assured of a bargain: Go!  

The adventure is in getting there.  Stage one is the parking lot.  You may need to get your alignment checked later.  Once you get close enough to park, you gotta find it.  There's not much signage. You need to know where you're going. Don't turn around it's really there. I went in through the entrance next to the grocery.  You will wonder if the surrounding businesses are open.  Keep walking.  A few steps in you wonder if the a/c is working.  It's the south, it's supposed to be hot.  Stay cool, don't gawk.  You start to think this kinda looks like a movie set.  Legitimate businesses (food establishments no less) can't really be functioning in here.  Ignore what looks like used to be fountains or decor. Ambiance that's all it is.

The menu is brief.  You know why you're here.  Service is friendly and welcoming as well as informative.  It is also quick.  By the time you get over the sticker shock, you know those have to be retro prices. Your order is ready.  I must admit I spent way too much time thinking of the sardine sandwich I didn't get.  I got the 2 #7s one spicy. Don't try it if you don't think a certain amount of pain is necessary to enjoy good food.  You'll will devour half of it before you realize you're consuming a whole jalapeno.  The combination of pickled vegs and fresh cilantro lull you into a false sense of security.  The bread is perfectly crisp and then soft and yielding.  By the time you feel the heat effusing down your throat and warming your face, you are done.  

You feel like you've accomplished something just getting there.  The sandwiches assure you that it was worth it.  A GREAT spot.   Everything you probably heard about this place is likely true.  You gotta try it.

Every time I go buy groceries at Asian Corner Mall I try to remember to take some cash with me so that I can stop by and purchase some Bahn Mi sandwiches from this place. I always get the special combination sandwich w/ the veggies on the side. My family is a fan of their sandwiches and I also like to purchase the bubble teas from here. The sandwiches are very decently price and they are super fast. The only downfall is that they take cash only so make sure you bring cash.
Hands-down they have the best sandwiches and Charlotte - if you call yourself a foodie you have to try it

I don't get it.  I love Vietnamese food, I'm passionate about fresh baguettes, and after reading the glowing reviews here I made my way to Le's Sandwich Shop anticipating a real treat.

First of all, the semi-abandoned, shady-looking mall smells faintly of urine and stale fish sauce, and has dodgy-looking men standing in dark corners.  If you enter and exit the center entrance, you'll at least miss most of that experience.  Careful you don't lose a wheel in the war-torn parking lot (which is easily as bad as the worst parking lot in which you've ever driven).  

Then the bread everyone raves about, and refers to as a baguette.  It's not a baguette except by the most Sarah Lee white-bread pre-frozen definition of a sandwich roll.  This is NOT a French baguette by any stretch of the imagination, and it doesn't resemble any mini-baguette you'll find at a good Vietnamese French bakery.  It's soft, no-crust white bread and almost tasteless.  

The Vietnamese sandwich ingredients aren't bad, and the sandwiches are cheap, but that's the best I can say for the experience.  The bread rolls were 75 cents.  Bread is half the experience (at least) of a good sandwich, and this bread isn't worth the wheat.

Makes me wonder about you Charlotteans and your French bread experience.  Is there any place in Charlotte to buy a good baguette or bátard that's actually fresh-baked, rather than frozen and thawed?  I want sourdough and crunchy crust, people.

Oh Banh Ti, how I have missed you!
Cute mom and pop sandwich shop with some homemade goodies on display, tables, so it does not feel like a mini-market.
Located in a semi-derelict Asian mall which I hope does not close.  Rap/Hip Hop stores also here.  And a few homeless people.

Honestly we don't know of any other places that sell them, so this is always our go-to place when we crave Vietnamese sandwiches, even though it is a long drive for us.  They haven't disappointed us yet.  The parking lot is in terrible shape and there's nothing else worthwhile in this empty "mall", but despite that there always seem to be a constant stream of customers in this sandwich shop.  That should tell you how much people like them.

Everyone says order the number 6 and they're right. $3.50 gets you an amazing sandwich in an interesting location and I'm sure a few stories to tell.

Be careful because the other review are correct in saying this sandwich can be spicy. We've eaten here twice, the most recent we had a much better experience with more care taken to deseed the peppers. However the first time we at there both of us were pretty  uncomfortable for about a half hour after eating with our mouths on fire.

A must go experience, don't let the outward appearance of the mall foul you.

I may sound petty but I hate getting ripped off or tricked. We bought 2 sandwiches (3.75 each) which should be $7.50 and assuming with tax, it should be not a dollar more in taxes. However my total came out to $8.62. The man doesn't give out receipts and do not take credit cards meaning IRS can't track how much he really makes. Unless taxes are 15% in Charlotte, I don't know how it came out to that much. Usually I would buy 5 or 6 so I don't really pay much attention but this time, I was really able to calculate. If the sandwich is $4 and not $3.75, he needs to stop being shady and update his signage. The man is rich. Cash only is shady business. No receipt for customers to see break down of your purchase. Super shady.
If you are looking for something amazing.. Stop here! I love #6 & #7. I can't get enough of this place! They also sell homemade beef jerky that I enjoy! P.S They don't accept credit cards..

My wife and I rushed from work to experience what Le Sandwiches has to offer. They close promptly at 6pm. And I mean at 6pm!! But, it was well worth it! I'm driving and eating at the same time because it was sooo good!! Finding it was a problem at first because it looked like Apocalypse Now movie set!! But don't be discouraged!! Hold tight because your taste buds are gonna love it!! By the way!!! Make sure you have good shocks and struts because the parking lot has more craters than the the Moon!

Word on the street was snag the no. 6, so I went in blind and asked for the 6. The shop itself is in a dilapidated, post-hurricane-looking, disaster stricken strip mall. It's certainly an adventure, especially if you pay attention to sanitation scores...

Absolute gem. Delicious friggin sangwich.

This place gets 5 stars for the Sandwiches and total experience.  Once you get here and see the location you'll realize how good the Sandwiches are.  

Don't take your mother in law.

Highly recommended.

Love love love. Their location is sketchy since it's inside Asian Corner but they literally have THE BEST BANH MAI in Charlotte NC. Don't judge this place. I've been coming here since I was 7 years old. It is also family owned. Best recommend to anyone looking for a great Banh Mi.

Great sandwiches! We grabbed the #6 and took it to a nearby watering hole. It was perfect for a little picnic, but watch out for the jalapenos! (We visit the grocery store regularly so were not surprised by the ambiance of the parking lot / shopping center.)

You won't get a better banh mi in charlotte then you will here.

Don't let the parking lot and occasional hobo's scare you away.

Cash only

The restaurant gets a lot of hype on yelp and other news so I decide to check it out.

It is in the sketchy part of town and there is no sign on the exterior of the mall so it was a little difficult to find. The service as great and the people were really nice.

The food was good, not great but for the price it wasn't bad. I want to go back and check out the rest of the asian mall when the gf isn't with me. I enjoy sketchy places more than she does I guess.

Both husband and wife owners are very stuck up.  They treat customers like sh*t.  They would arbitrarily charge taxes whoever they like and not charge some others at their discretion. When I confronted them they said they are the owners and they can chose to charge taxes or not at their discretion. So stupid.

My mom and I stopped here on a drive south to Atlanta. Easy to get to from off the highway location wise... Everyone else is right, the Asian mall it's in is straight outta the Walking Dead. However, Le's is well worth it and it's very clean inside. People couldn't be nicer. 

The sandwich though! We got the #6 grilled pork. Amazing. They do everything right. Jalapeños were very hot and my lips burned for a while after but it was well worth it. I'll make it a regular stop from now on... So delicious.
Best Banh Mi sandwich I've ever had! As fresh and authentic as it gets!
Fantastic! The BBQ pork and pâté sandwiches were so good. Can't wait to go back. Take cash, though.
I actually love this place to the max! I just love the warm welcome that he gives you and he has a polite attitude while serving his sandwiches! This place deserves more than 5 stars!!!
Great sandwiches for a great price. No fuss in ordering your sandwich and a good variety with a nice crispy baguette.

Well.... what else is there to say that hasn't already been said:

- Parking lot and location: sucks
- Man behind the counter: friendly
- Banh Mi: awesome
- Value: great

I'll be back - but next time I'll bring my Jeep!
Great Prices,  fresh bread, unusual but delicious.  Definitely going to be a regular stop!

I have to say the number 6 was good .  Though I wish it had a little more meat on it. 
Let me bring one thing to your attention. This sandwich is HOT. omg I did not know  this sandwich was going to be so hot. my mouth was burning for I dont know how long. It is a very good sandwich with out the HEAT. PLEASE be aware. Im sure there are others that didnt know it was so hot. I noticed that the Hotness was coming from the bell peppers they put on there..

The sandwiches are great-- as are the prices.  The fact that so many reviews here comment on the "post-apocalyptic" setting shows the lamentable suburban Charlotte mindset that everything needs to be tidy, safe, and predictable.  This is why Chalotte is such a poster child for chain restaurants, conformity, and lack of creativity.  This mall is a good look into the 3rd world, and has nothing to fear.  The cheap real estate is a blessing that attracts unique restaurants, shops and wonderful ethnic diversity.  

In other cities, there would be a thriving artist scene in this area with galleries, music venues, etc. and would be rushing for gentrification. Then the $4 sandwich would be $9.95 like in Ballantyne, Huntersville, etc.  I've been going to this mall for years, mainly to shop the amazing Asian-African food markets.  It's a wonderful cultural island-- and I hope it stays this way, including potholes... to keep out the moneyed riff-raff.

The menu might be 91% meat based but that 1 veggie sand which was spicy and a good value...one hidden gem of Asian cuisine hidden in a terribly outdated building.  The beverages available were mostly healthy if that makes a difference!

The best value for lunch in Charlotte. I crave *this* bahn mi and am never disappointed.  Shopping center/parking lot comments, sure. This shop is impeccably clean and an oasis in the middle of all of the chaos but...wow. Forever consistant and delicious

The baguette, freshly baked, is the greatest gift the French left Vietnam after colonial rule, back when they referred to the peninsula as French Indochina.  Little did the French know that the locals would convert a colonial relic, perhaps an unhappy reminder of a time where the people on the peninsula were subjugated, into something delicious and beautiful by combining the baguette and pate from the French with typical local ingredients.

I'm of course referring to the Vietnamese sandwich known as banh mi, aka "The People's Sandwich" (my own term) but then again most people reading this review are familiar.  Or at least you should be, because if you aren't, as far as I'm concerned you are missing out on an epicurean delight that is worth seeking out.  As is the case with a lot of food from local immigrant communities, those who dig around are the ones who are richly rewarded.  Which brings me to Le's Sandwiches.

As has been documented by other Yelpers, Le's is located within an Asian pedestrian mall that you might suspect is effectively abandoned. Walking into the mall you quickly realize that this is basically the case at Asian Corners.  You would never suspect that this place houses a small restaurant that serves wonderful banh mi.  

Forget the "sketchy" aspect - this is normal and real life for a lot of people, especially within immigrant communities.  Put the suburban, culturally sanitized perspective aside and realize that dining out as we know it is a culinary anomaly in the larger context of things.  In other words, man/woman the hell up and just go get your damn sandwich, capisce? You won't regret this trip and I bet you'll be slinking back, maybe with a friend who hasn't tried a Vietnamese sandwich before. I would if I lived in Charlotte.

Tonight I had the grilled pork banh mi. I don't have words for the experience of a warm baguette in your hands filled with meat, pickled veggies, cilantro, etc.  The combinations available to you with banh mi can be foreign; however, what will not be foreign to you is the taste of home that you get.  You quickly understand that this is comfort food from a culture on the other side of the world.  This is why seeking out food like this is so addicting to me - I'm obsessed with learning about cultures through food.

The sandwiches are very good, friggin' cheap and the service is friendly (this is a mom and pop sandwich shop - mom made my sandwich today!).  It may be possible to find banh mi elsewhere in Charlotte, but as an out-of-towner who is only passing through, I would urge you to consider taking this food field trip.  It's a mile from Smelly Cat, you greasy hipsters!

For the banh mi and a drink - $4.92 after tax.  Take a guess what I think Mickey D's can do with their value meal!

Cinco estrellas.  I'm a fan but if I lived in Charlotte I'd be a superfan. There would be a Le family portrait with me superimposed within.

TIP: The drink case.   When in doubt reach for a can of the lychee and get your drink on.  It's pleasant and sweet, a nice refresher against the pepper in the banh mi you are inhaling/eating.  Don't forget to shake first.  Your booty then the can. =P

We were a little apprehensive about actually going inside the mall once we navigated what has to be the worst kept parking lot I've ever seen, but darn we were glad we did. The owner (I assume) was super nice and guided us to the #6 pork sandwich. Absolutely amazing sandwich and it was less than $5. I'll probably order two next time. Highly recommended and I will be going here at least three times a month.

Best sandwich in town hands down. You have to try the sugar cane juice. Very refreshing. The sandwiches are big and very tasty. The vegetables are fresh and not soggy. We're about an hour away but worth the drive. Location isn't all that great but ignore the surroundings and go for the customer service and food.
This place was amazing.  What a hidden gem!  The sandwich was fantastic!   GREAT prices, GREAT food, GREAT service!  I will be back this coming week for more!  Thanks for being here!

Was pleasantly surprised by this hidden restaurant. You can't judge this place by appearances-we were pretty skeptical going into the mall, considering its full of boarded up shops and is eerily quiet. Upon entering the restaurant, you are greeted by Le himself with a smile on his face. Very friendly guy offering up some delicious grub. Highly recommend a try for both food and experience.

Bahn mi sandwiches are one of my favorite foods on the planet. When I lived in Boston, I'd go downstairs and choose from one of the many hole-in-the-wall bahn mi shops and pick up a smoky grilled meat, crispy warm bread, tangy spicy veggie mixed sandwich for about $2. 

Le's isn't quite that magical, but as my friend Jen says... is the best option you can get in Charlotte. 

I honestly don't suggest going after the sun goes down. I think it's kind of scary in the daytime actually.  Th strip mall it's located in features several unsavory looking home-grown carwashing operations.  Ignore them.  Ignore the chipped, cracked asphalt. Put on your best "I'm a badass foodie" face and strut into the strip mall.  Nobody should bother you.

The sandwich board features all the options, ranging from the cold cut variety or sandwich to grilled chicken and pork, etc. They're cheap (about $3, $3.50ish) and come in a long paper bag for easy transport.  You'll find some folks order a dozen at a time and sometimes there's a line.  It's a popular place. 

The sandwich is good.  It really hits the spot when the bahn mi craving hits.  However...there's no juiciness, so the sandwich is a tad drier than I'm used to.  However, there is plenty of veggie goodness in each sandwich, so the overall balance is good. 

Check it out if you're in the area, or craving something cheap and delicious!

The closer I got to Le's, the more and more Roland's voice sounded like Colonel Kurtz from "Apocalypse Now."  Time slowed down a bit, and my senses heightened.  I found myself deeply inhaling through my nostrils for the smell of napalm.  

We arrived sans metal detector and traversed through the parking lot minefield unscathed nonetheless.  Instead of eyeballing for the entrance to the barracks, my eyes scanned for enemy combatants until my compatriot lauded the "all clear."

No guards, no signs...this must be the place.  We knew the praise for Le's must be the real deal Holyfield.

This is one of those locations that you had no issue traipsing around and adventuring to before marriage and kids.  Now you're appraising the vehicle you're driving and wondering if your life insurance is up to date.  Just kidding...or am I?  This is the "used to be the used to be the sorta strange but kinda okay" mall.  

"First time?"  "We look THAT green, eh?"  Number 6 with peppers it is.

When I finally got off the floor, I did the, "this is soooo freaking good" head nod...to have it reciprocated.  I was not expecting what I saw on the sign...or in the basket...to taste that good!  Even the aftermath belches taste great (yea...I said it...don't judge me)!

The sandwich was a marinated pork, pickled veggies, and fresh jalapenos on a....

Let's talk about the bread here. Do you remember the Kid and Play movie, "House Party?"  No?  Me neither.

Moving on then...

No...but really, the dance-off part of that movie.  The bread that this sandwich is made on makes me want to do that entire scene.  Ankle grabbed, hand behind head...and wildly flailing my leg back and forth.  I also feel an intense urge to bust out some old metal band front kicks while putting up the horns and yelling, "Slayer!" How those two things go together, you'll never know...since I just chalk it up to being strange. Trust me, it's me...not you.

Is it possible that my first experience has made me an addict?  I want this for dinner now too.  Can I buy a couple of these and stick them in the fridge...or do I need to man-up and deploy again?


To do:  Brave the sketch

To don't: Tell Marc

A friend recommended Le's, and man, am I glad she did! Delicious grilled pork banh mi and friendly, welcoming, kind service. The location and shopping center itself is kind of run-down, but this sandwich shop is truly great and offers a nice experience. I'm a fan!

They do a really good job here at making banh mi. I've had banh mi from Cali and Chicago so i understand the art of a good banh mi. I had the special and they asked if I wanted to keep the pickling separate until I'm ready to eat it at home. That's really thoughtful because when I got home, I toasted the banh mi in the toaster oven for a few minutes to get that extra cruch factor and then added the pickling. The meat was delicious and the pickling was just perfect. The length of the bread alone was more than I expected. I'm glad that there is a good banh mi place in Charlotte. Can't wait to try other items on the menu.
Best sandwiches in town, period!  The parking lot looks like it's been shelled by WWII planes, but don't let that deter you.  Reminds me of Asia every time I walk in.

I found this place on yelp when I was looking for a new lunch place for me and my coworkers..  Glad I read the reviews about the location and food!  I was longing for a good banh mi and ordered the #6 without peppers.  It was fresh, fast, and the prices are amazing!  It makes walking through the old, unairconditioned mall, where shadows lurk and seedy characters are around the corner worth it!  This place is a complete gem.  Inside the restaurant it was spotless!  Where else in Charlotte can you buy 4 delicious sandwiches plus 2 canned drinks for $17 and change?  Nowhere and I'll be back again for my banh mi fix and with the money I save, maybe I'll splurge on a bodyguard ; ).

The. best. banh. mi. 

You get an authentic third world country experience when you come here. From the deplorable parking lot, to the grim "mall" inside. You don't need to go to Vietnam, just come here and get the best banh mi in town. Their fresh sugar cane drink is fantastic for those with a sweet tooth. They've also got tasty beef jerky too. I really hope it's beef.

Owner is very rude to me, I'm clearly order Thai tea with boba drink, he gave me a smoothie instead. I ask him to redo it and he end up gave me attitude and accuse me order the smoothie. I never like Thai tea smoothies drink. I feel like I'm back in Vietnam fish market.

The BAD:
Drive slow, the parking lot is like a mine field of car swallowing pot holes. You will want to turn around when you get to the parking lot. You will question why you're even thinking of eating here. You will be lost because there are no signs on the outside, follow the signs for the food and go to the store fronts pictured in the yelp photos.

The GOOD:
THE FOOD and the friendly man taking your order! The place is very clean even though the strip mall around it is falling apart. I hear the jerky sold there is good, haven't tried it yet.

Order the chicken #2 and the grilled pork #6, one will fill you up but you will want more later. Also pick up a fresh squeezed sugar cane juice (with a touch of orange), or maybe 2 because I finished mine on the way to the car.

There are tables to eat at but I suggest take-out.

Like so many reviewers have already mentioned, I also like the pork #6. My next choice is the special combination (#7). The best Bhan Mi I've found so far. Also try their ice drink/dessert in the cups in the fridge, they are very good especially if you like coconut milk base drinks, but not many reviews mentioned about this. Unfortunately the pot holes that has been there for years never got fixed.

"This looks like a post apocolyptic world"- My husband as we were driving up to the shopping center to check out Le's.

I have heard great things about this place and it has been on my bucket list for a while now. This past Friday, my husband and I checked it out for lunch. The parking lot is a big old mess. Literally, would have never found this place if it wasn't for Yelp. However, I have always been taught to not judge a book by it's cover. Totally true for Le's!

To get inside, you have to literally go inside the shopping center and it will pop up on the right. As we walked in and started reading the menu, it was obvious that we were lost. The cashier immediately asked if we have eaten at Le's before. After saying no, he gave us a tour of the menu and recommendations, which was great!

We decided on the #6 (most popular thing ordered)- Pork Bahn Mi and the #8 BBQ Pork. Both sandiwches were nice sizes. Total bill $8.......$4 a sandwich!!! Just as a FYI, it is cash only. 

Both sandwiches were delish. The pickled carrots, cilantro, and jalapenos were perfect toppings. I think both of us prefered the Bahn Mi slightly over the BBQ Pork.

Thanks Yelp for helping me find this place
Spicy, fresh, and delicious pork sandwich. Le, the owner, is super friendly and knows how to treat customers well. Great value too.
Best banh mi sandwich I've ever eaten so far.. I get usually 5 or 6 to go and if I am in Charlotte, I make sure its a stop there and Amelie french bakery.

I read the reviews on this place and they were on Thrillest.com, I had to come try it out for myself. I'm from the Central PA and we have many banh mi spots here. Le's banh mi tasted just like home and it was perfect. I had the #1 and a taro bubble tea. The place was sketchy and I didn't realize that the little shop was inside. I'm definitely getting more when I come back to Charlotte.
The banh mi sandwiches are delicious!  And at great prices!  (Cash Only)  However, the plaza is pretty barren so I recommend you get in, and get out.
Tricky to find but bomb sandwiches!!! The #6 is a great sandwich to start your first experience.

This is one of my go-to spots. You literally can not go wrong with Le's. I have been here well-over a dozen times and have NEVER had a bad experience. I've even recruited several people who are now die-hard fans of Le's. If you are looking for a delicious banh mi then this is your place. The freshness of the ingredients and crunchy deliciousness of the bread are unmatched. I know that other places claim to have banh mis that are good but to me they just aren't as simple and delicious as what Le's offers. Let me also point out...Le's Sandwiches are a proven hangover cure in my opinion! All for less than $4!

To be fair I can not comment on anything other than #6 (the grilled pork banh mi). Don't blame me though, I found what I liked and stuck with it! There are several sandwiches though to suit the pallet of any banh mi fan; I simply prefer the classic.

One could not write a review about Le's Sandwiches without commenting on the ambience. Le's Sandwiches is certainly off the beaten path and is tucked away in the Asian Mall off of N Tryon which at times looks like it was abandoned in the late 70's. Don't let the scenery fool you though. Le's Sandwiches is impeccably clean and well-kept. After enjoying a sandwich at Le's be sure to check out one of the Asian markets in the same area. Great stuff and one of the cheapest places I've found Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce!

I was on a road trip through Charlotte and we wanted a sandwich. Online reviews led us here. I seek out hole in the walls and love a delicious spot in a weird place. The boba tea was very good but the sandwich was not impressive, if this is the #1 sandwich shop in Charlotte I'm sorry for their other spots. It wasn't bad but wasn't good as many others I've had. Sandwich wasn't cut in half which was weird, and seemed to be making up for lack of meat by over stuffing carrots. Still for the price is was alright but I wouldn't rave about this place. Mostly it was the over hyped reviews I'm disappointed in.

One of the best sandwiches in town?  Not hardly.   Not that bad for luncmeat on a baguette, and the price is right for what you get but what you get is not much. No drinks, small sandwiches, no sides and no seating. 

if you are in the neighborhood, and by that I mean already parked and out of your car, fine go there. Definitely not something you drive to.

Pros: Cheap $3 sandwiches ( they are small, so don't expect a Subway-type sandwich). Tasty.

Cons: Ghetto strip mall, takes cash only, no AC in summer

This place is definitely the best banh mi I've found in CLT...although it's very dodgy trying to get there - but well worth it.  I think they get their bread fresh, which is essential - I'm basing my opinion on my experiences with Lee's Sandwiches found on the west coast - pretty much a staple.

This place is amazing! Perfectly crispy and airy baguette with a balanced and wonderful mix of ingredients. For Bahn Mi, this place is tops over any other place in the US (and Cali Vietnamese sandwich shops are pretty phenomenal so making this statement means this place is amazing!) love the place. Hard to find and in a odd part of this strip mall, but totally worth finding!!!!

Le's, where do I start? I remember my first trip here. My girlfriend and I judged based on appearance from the outside of the mall to the inside but we wrong for that. This is our go to sandwich shop. We have had every sandwich but the sardine and they are all great. They make their baguette bread in house  with a perfect crisp. We really love the combination with pork, the grilled pork, and the meatball  banh mis the most. The grilled pork with the sauce jalepnos and pickled daikon and carrots, and cilantro is perfect every time. I have never been disappointed with this place and will alway be a regular. If you have not tried this place and lime banh mis you have to go to Le's.

I can't say enough about Le's.  Loved the entire experience of driving to a decrepit mall in the middle of nowhere to taste the best sandwich I've ever tried.  Le's offers a vegetarian option with soy meat.  Typically, I don't like soy meat and op just for veggies, but this one was so well done, it added to the sandwich.  The bread was also fabulous.  I don't know if he makes it or is just able to find bread like that, but it made the sandwich.

Foot long Viet sub for less than $4!  Awesome!  I love the sugar can drink too.  The Vietnamese coffee is not the best Vietnamese coffee that I've drank but I'll still order it.  As for the bubble tea, I had better bubble tea in the CLT area.  I actually prefer the bubble tea from Truc and that one place located on Boardwalk.

Screw Subway's "Februany" Footlong for Five Dollars.  Come to Le's and get a delicious Vietnamese footlong for only $3.50.  You can get one slightly smaller for only $3.

This place is truly a hole in the wall.  Le's is tucked away inside a Chinese strip mall that has a parking lot with more potholes than parking spots.  Le's is so obscure, I couldn't even see a sign for it on the outside of the strip mall.  It was only once I explored around inside the "Chinese Food Court" that I found it.

The sandwiches are legit.  Well seasoned pork, nicely cooked vegetables, a crispy soft warm baguette, and super cheap!


And if you want, you can pick up a cuttlefish for the road, which they neatly sell packaged in zip-lock bags.  I love it.
Very good vietmanese sandwiches! Good price for a good sized sandwich, I had the grilled pork one. The only downside is the location and all the potholes in the parking lot. Worth the effort though.

I am a fan of Vietnamese foods. I heard about this Banh Mi place. I went there twice, once last week and once this week. I ordered the pork and sardine sandwich in our first visit. The taste was okay, but not as good as those people described. There was not much sardine in the sandwich. We ordered the sardine once again on our second visit. It's better this time. More sardine this time. I guess the price is the big selling point. $4 a sandwich. What can you ask for??
Just go and eat all the things.  Don't forget cash only! I always do veggie sans jalapeños at lunch and get two and save one for dinner!  So delicious!

Quick service. Got a couple #1s(reg ham combo) and a couple #8s(bbq pork). The pork was alright but flavor and taste of the reg Ham combo was surprisingly delicious. The rest around the area cannot compare to it. I haven't had one that good in a while. 4.5 Stars.

Le's bahn mi is incredible.  The staff is always friendly and fast and the sandwiches are to die for!  So fresh and flavorful!  The prices are so reasonable.  I only wish they were in a more convenient location.  They are in the back of a strip mall with a parking lot riddled with potholes so it's always a challenge to get in and out, yet when all is said and done, it's worth it!
The best Banh Mi I have ever had. This place -- though in a kind of broken down strip mall -- is incredibly clean and organized. The Banh Mi is a great price and is incredibly delicious.

Quick, cheap, and great!

I can't believe I have not reviewed this place before.  I go there all the time.

First of all, it isn't easy to find.  You have to go to the Asian mall at the corner of sugar creek in Tryon.  The parking lot is rough, I mean ROUGH!  Pot holes everywhere, some mangled speed bumps as well.  The mall looks pretty ghetto too, but I don't know of any crime there.  Once you drive by all the stores you'll probably notice a pho place, a few grocery stores, and some nail salons, but no banh mi.  You actually have to go up in this run down mall.  The best entrance is towards the end away from Tryon.  Go in about a hundred feet and you'll see Le's on the right.

Its sooooo good.  There"s an easy to identify menu with numbers.  Always ask for it on a baguette, its like 50-75 cents more but you get a whole lot more food.  I suggest trying them all, but I normally go for the combo or the pate.  Pay the extra little bit for pate regardless of which sandwich, it makes it.  The pickled veggies are extremely crunchy but watch out, sometimes there is an extra large chunk of hot pepper in there.

They have bubble tea, some Gatorade and a couple other offerings as far as drinks go.  There"s a few small tables, but I normally take mine to go.

Not really that much else to say, just go, you won't be disapointed.

I'm biased about this place just because we have been eating sandwiches from here since I was born. This store is timeless and the sandwich (#1 on the menu; banh mi thit nguoi) is a classic. I honestly don't think I've had better banh mi than this place nor will I really ever crave any from anywhere else! We live an hour away, so every time we go we stack up on sandwiches.

Thank you, thank you, thank you to Pourina R., Ben G., and Chad E. for telling me about amazing sandwich shop. Not only do they have amazing Vietnamese sandwiches, but they are some of the best sandwiches I have ever had.

Yes the shop may not be in the nicest place...you will need to find your own path to drive through in the parking lot, and the inside of the building is dirty and rundown. But, it does not hurt the experience of this restaurant at all.

We tried the #6 and #7. The number #6 is there grilled pork banh mi. We added pate to it and it did not disappoint. It was likely the most flavorful out of the two. It was also the spiciest. The #7 is there combination special which comes with multiple types of pork. It was a great sandwich but not as good as the #6. Both sandwiches came on a long baguette roll and topped with cucumbers, pickled vegetables, and fresh herbs. We washed down the sandwiches with their fresh squeezed sugar cane juice. It was the first time I had sugar cane. I really enjoyed it. The juice was not overly sweet and super refreshing.

 After we ate our sandwiches, I was very tempted to order two other sandwiches to bring home for dinner. I promise you it is that good. 

Oh, did I mention that these tasty, flavorful sandwiches cost less than $4 a sandwich...Seriously? How is that even possible?

There's not much about Le's that hasn't already been said... Tucked away in the Asian corner mall with potholes bigger than my Toyota, Le's is an absolute gem that I take all my friends to when we want exceptional food at great prices. My only reason for 4 stars is that the pickled veggies are a bit too spicy sometimes, but the bread is always fresh, the portions consistent, and the overall quality is excellent. Don't let the location scare you off from venturing inside, everyone is very friendly and welcoming.

So far, the best and most consistent Banh Mi in Charlotte; yes it is worth the 45 minute drive when there's no traffic. 

Not much more to say but if you know Banh Mithen  go here and get yourself some. If you're not familiar with Banh Mi then go here and try a great sandwich experience (and you're welcome!).

The best banh mi dac biet I've ever tasted. It beats banh mi in Atlanta & Lee's sandwich in California & Las Vegas! So I heard they order their meat from California & they make their banh mi fresh there at the place. Everything tastes perfect! I live in South Carolina & always make the drive to Charlotte to order banh mi to go. A little expensive when you order 10 of them but it's definitely worth every penny.

Le's is such an awesome adventure.  Dodge the pot holes, brave the elements of the creepy Asian mall and score the most highly regarded Bahn Mi sandwich in the city.  My order is always the #6 grilled pork, extra meat, add pâté and it never disappoints.  I also like to throw a little Sriracha on top back at the house for an extra kick!

So, I've been putting this review off for a while, upset that I did not have the amazing experience like everyone else. I hate that I hated this place, but that's the way it is. 

Getting here was an absolute mess. I have never been to the part of town before and was scared, even in the safety of my car. The inside was no better. It looks like a post-apocololytpic, abandoned, east Detroit strip mall with garbage on the floors and graffiti on the walls.

Le's isn't much better, but appeared to be clean and I was hungry so I stepped up to the plate and ordered the combo and grilled pork sanwhiches. Some nice guy in front of me tossed the cashier some extra money and paid for my sandwiches...really nice and a much needed spirit boost after my tumultuous ride in.

So, I have had some very good Bahn Mi sandwiches before and these were no better. The meat just tasted...old. The best part were the baguettes, which I have to admit, were pretty good.

So then, I bite into something with a gummy, rubbery texture and bright pink (see picture). Perhaps, this is supposed to be in the sandwich (somebody please tell me if this is the case) but it absolutely disgusted me and I wound up throwing out the rest of both sandwiches.

In short, this place is way to far off the beaten path and frankly, in a dangerous area. Save yourself the time and stress and go elsewhere.
Tried the pork banh mi and it was great. The bread, pickled daikon/carrots, pork, cilantro, jalapeno were all fresh and it was only around $4. I should have gotten two! No complaints at all.

Why haven't I reviewed this place before? Whether I am going to IKEA, to Charlotte, or just passing by, I always stop to grab a Bahn mi sandwich here.

Don't let the post-apocalyptic look of the mall discourage you. On the inside the restaurant is spic-n-span. Sanitation rating of 98.5. (Can't say as much for the mall bathroom - go before you arrive.)

They offer 10 varieties of sandwiches.  I always get the pork, with a slight preference for the grilled (#6) over the barbecue (#8).

The key to Bahn mi is the bread and the contrasts - sweet, savory, acidic, tender, crunchy. Le's does all that very well.

One warning: the sandwiches come with raw peppers. If you can't handle spicy, ask for without.
The Bahn Mi is excellent. I've eaten Bahn Mi across the Gulf Coast Vietnamese diaspora and Le's is now in my top three. The bread and pork were on point. Plus, they're a fantastic deal!
Le's is the best lunch spot in Charlotte. The #6 is my favorite but you can't go wrong with anything on their menu. I also love the fresh pressed sugar cane juice.

If you can look past the buildings outward appearance you will find some fantastic food. Got the number six, grilled pork. It was tender and juicy, and there was a nice bite to the sandwich from the fresh jalapenos. Paired it with a honeydew bubble tea which was also excellent. Great food and inexpensive too. Would definitely recommend this place.

Simple and perfect. 

Try not to be intimidated by the location and the mall that you enter as you find your way to Le's. The food is legit AF. I had a pork bahn mi and a tarro bubble tea, I was in my happy place. The sandwiches are dirt cheap, most are $4.25. Get one for now and one for later if you know good food. The tarro bubble tea was also really good and the tarro flavor is hard to find. The seating is super limited so if it's a date night plan on a picnic. The guy at the counter was welcoming and explained everything you would need to know if you are new to this. 

Fast and fresh; don't miss this one!
Really good sandwiches! And got to have sugarcane juice lol. Also, the fresh beef jerky is good :)

Once in a while, I make my way up to Sugar Creek to eat at Le's Sandwiches. Eating here brings back great memories. When I was little, I would hold my mom's hand as we ponder through the Asian grocery store in front of Le's. I always look forward to what happens after grocery shopping. YES, you guessed it-BANH MI (Vietnamese sandwiches)... and freshly made SUGARCANE JUICE!! I haven't been back here in years and now as I sit, sipping on my sugarcane, people watching and yelping away, I notice the crowd that this tiny, hidden gem has drawn over the years. The line has been never-ending since we've gotten here! If you haven't ventured to Le's, I ensure the journey is worth it. Try #1-Combination. I'm not really sure what combination meat entails, but it essentially doesn't matter. The grilled pork banh mi is also one of my favorites. No matter which one you land on.. get the long bread, tell them to add butter, have it toasted and eat it there -WITH Sugarcane juice. You're welcome :) 

If this isn't enough to convince you, my 90lbs mother just finished her entire sandwich and ordered one more. Yup that was definitely the last bite of the SECOND sandwich she just devoured. FYI: These are about foot long sandwiches -and for only $2.75-$4 each. Beat that, Subway!

Bad customer services, my girlfriend order Thai tea with boba, she end up getting Thai tea with boba smoothie. We ask the owner to change it, he gave her attitude and said that's what she order and will not change it. Very low class customer services. We will not come back again.

I almost didn't find this place! I thought it was inside one of the super markets next to Asian Corner Mall and the offerings there looked disappointing. Once I walked into the mall And found Le's I was relieved that I had passed on the mistaken location. 

I ordered a #2 Grilled Chicken and a #6 Grilled Pork to split with my brother. My favorite was the pork due to the meat being more flavorful. The baguettes were toasted to crunchy perfection. I couldn't go without adding a few squirts of Sriracha to complete the experience.

The prices for the sandwiches are outstanding! $3.50, tops. 
Makes me sad that I'm only visiting Charlotte and I wish I could find something similar in Raleigh.

Every time I drive around Sugar Creek and Tryon, I think it is time to try Le's Sandwiches and I never stop.  Today I was craving Middle Eastern food, as much as I wanted tabouli, I decided today was the day for bahn mi from Le's. Yes, today is the day!

It is everything a foodie, eatee, adventure eater, tourist, you name it, it fills the void.  Off the beaten path- check, inexpensive -check, fresh ingredients 
-check, friendly service- check, in a shopping center that feels like it's abandoned - check.  A little sketchy, where you see all walks of life- check. 
A funnel cake vendor in the parking lot-check.  A group of car detailers in the parking lot- check.  A huge Asian market to stock the pantry -items that are a million dollars at Harris Teeter- check. 

Props to a simple menu, fresh ingedients, made with love and reasonably priced.  Le is the man.

Awesome food!

Le's Banh Mi is probably the best I've ever hard.  I've even experienced other places, but this one is the best.  

I always order the #1, but sometimes get the #7.  I love it that they make it in house, right in front of you and when you bite in... the crispy baguette crunch is the best.

Don't forget to wash it down with Yeo's Soy Bean Milk drink :)
Finally made it up here. After living in Hawaii, I've never found a Bahn Mi sandwich that makes the grade!

Equal parts adventure, experience, culinary safari, near scrapes with overtly life-threatening conditions for any vehicle, and personality. Goodness gracious. I've loved Banh Mi for years, but Le's has sparked a fire-y passion in my little Vietnamese cuisine-loving heart. 

Made it in on a Sunday afternoon, it was packed, and we were amongst tons of regulars. It was a great. My being green around the gills was easy to spot all the way from the cratered parking lot. 

Follow instructions on every other review you'll read here. Asian Corner, walk down the (awesomely dirty and strongly loved) hallway, hang a right, and get ready for a sandwich worth it's weight in gold. 

Now, there are tons of options. I wanted to swing for a grand slam of "Wow! I've never even heard of that!" but decided not to vie with au originale. #6 on a long baguette, please. It was....so good it rendered me speechless and with a face full of fantastically balanced Banh Mi. The bread.....my dear, sweet....it was perfect. So crunchycrispy, soft interior, slight chew. What kind of delicious sorcery made this bread?!?! Just absolutely perfect. The veggie combo -- standard pickle-y carrots, onions, and jalapenos. The pork. I've been missing out on this the entire time I've lived in Charlotte until now. One bite and you'll be a believer. (I've been told to call an audible and add paté to the #6. Next time: Done.) Oh, and much like the aforementioned, suckers are like $3 a pop. 

I'm a believer. Addict. Cheerleader. Wondrously and deliriously complete now that I've experienced Le's. If you're reading this, Owner/Management/Sandwich Artist, please accept my humble Thank You for all that you do.

If Disney World is the happiest place on earth than Asian Corners Shopping Plaza is hard in the running for the sketchiest place on earth. That being said, it is worth the trip to get one of Le's delicious bahn mi.

I went with the, seemingly bordering on iconic, #6 and for a mere $3.79 in coin of the realm I was given an unassuming white bag and sent on my merry way. Only when i got back to my office and dug in did i discover the perfectly crispy bread, sweet (but not too sweet) pork, crunchy veggies and fragrant cilantro. I really planned to save half for lunch tomorrow, I swear - plans change.

The food is absolutely 5 stars, and if you can get someone to go and pick it up for you you will have one of the most perfect lunches there is, but I have to take one star for location. I mean really, it is a s*%t hole. (And yes I'm sure that's why they are able to stay so cheap, but thems the breaks.)
I love this place. very affordable and tasty. their menu caters to different tastes.

Insert comment about the terrible location and post apocalyptic parking lot. Insert another comment about the weird mall layout. Then insert the comment about the cleanliness of this place, insanely cheap price, and how awesome these sandwiches really are.

I definitely wouldn't have found this place if it wasn't for yelp. Now I make it a point to stop by any time I am in the area. While the Bahn Mi sandwich concept is a simple one, Le's crafts them to perfection. I prefer #6 (pork), which will set you back a whopping $4. Make sure to bring cash as they do not accept credit cards.

Hands down my favorite place in Charlotte. Truly appreciate this establishment. Been coming here for years, and they make you feel like you're wanted. Their food is 100% consistent, and the service is remarkable. They exhibit how a place should be run. Great brigade system, and it's family owned. To watch a family work with each other, and well is refreshing. Tradition lives! Also, make sure to bring cash. No cards excepted, but it's always worth the trip here.

I don't understand the ratings. Let's be fair. This is not a good bahn mi restaurant at all.

First, for the banh mi itself , it is not impressive at all. I know at least two else places nearby that have much better banh mi (for example, bahn mi brothers).

Second, for the environment, it is located in a ruined plaza with destroyed parking lot. Once you find it, you will figure out that it does not have a maintained restroom. There is no place for you to wash your hands. Why do you want to wash your hands? Because they are cash only and your hands must touch the money before the banh mi.

Third, they charge for cup of water.

After all, I would think it illegal to open a restaurant without a place to be able to wash your hands. I don't know how I can report it to the  authorities. I don't recommend this place.

If you could describe Le's in a phrase, it's a pearl in an oyster. 

Le's is located in the Asian Corner shopping mall with some very rough parking. 

I get the #1 {Le's Combination} and the flavors of this sandwich are fantastic! Everything tastes perfectly balanced together. 

The best part about this place is the price. It's only $4 for the sandwich that I get! That's for a whole baguette!! I only get half of a sandwich for $7-8 in the triangle area!!! (Can you tell I'm excited?)

This place is great. Please go (make sure you bring cash, it's cash only).

They do Vietnamese sandwiches and do them well. My favorites are #9 (fish/sardines) and #6 pork. They are all excellent and if they got any cheaper they would be paying you. The baguettes are long and full of good flavors; prices are about $3 to $4. To find it enter the "mall" by the Asian food supermarket and take a right. If you are put off by the run down "mall" it is in you should not call yourself a foodie.
Trek through the dilapidated mall to the most delicious sandwiches you'll find anywhere. Very clean and professional atmosphere. One sandwich is enough, but I usually get two since they're so great.

Absolutely phenomenal in all aspects! I've watched the shopping area grow and die over the course of years and Le's is a hidden gem that I hope will continue to stay for the next many years. I grew up eating banh mi, whether it was for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or a snack. I have never had a better sandwich at any other banh mi place than Le's. I love Banh Mi Thit Nguoi, it's one of my faves just because all the meats and everything compliments each other so well. They have plenty of small snacks on the side too in case you wanted to add a little something extra to your meal. The Sugarcane drink is delicious and very refreshing. The family is extremely nice and service is very quick. I wish they accepted cards too and not just cash! Maybe one day though, right?

Simply the best Bahn Mi in Charlotte.  Hands down.  Nothing else really to say.  If you have not been here you are missing out.  Now as others have stated it is located in very strange looking old mall.  So overcome whatever fears you may have and go.  You will not be disappointed with the food.  A group of us from my office typically make a run to Le's once or twice a month and we would go more if it were closer.  Also if you like Asian cooking there is a little Asian grocery store that we usually stop and and restock on supplies.  Well worth the trip.
best banh mi place in charlotte. Just do it.

The sandwiches are soooo delicious! My boyfriend and I found the place randomly on Yelp and immediately fell in love. We came back today and got four for our road trip! My favorite is the grilled pork baguette. Jalapeños add a nice spicy touch!

This does not LOOK like a great place to eat but this is a real food gem find. Past the broken pavement and derelict buildings is a real treat. Le's pricing only enhances the experience - (I'm thinking they aren't wasting a lot of money on rent). It's all good, better to invest in top notch fresh ingredients and unique offerings. They hit the mark on both counts. Best strategy is to pick it up and go or do like me and eat in your car with the doors locked, of course.
See pictures above, I had a spicy pork Bahn Mi. It was warm bread with fresh cilantro and Asian heat on the inside lovingly wrapped around cool crisp vegetables and well seasoned pork. The warm texture of the bread really makes it such a treat. Just a perfect amount of crunch to the bread. I washed it down with something special...a freshly made (right in front of me) Sugar cane juice over ice. Sweeter than your first Kiss!
I will be back soon!

I don't know if ppl in charlotte have ever had bahn mi in other cities or not, but this was not a good experience. Bread is over toasted to make sure it's crispy, but that is it, not authentic. Avg ingredients. I've had bahn mi in many places and many cities. This was below avg. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here. Bahn mi Saigon in Greensboro is worth trying if you have a chance bc they bake their own bread, but it's not here at Le's. This place is not worth it for me. I can do without ever coming back to this place. Please find another bahn mi elsewhere.

I love a good Bánh Mì, and As soon as I read the reviews for this place when scoping out Charlotte, I knew it was a legitimate heavy hitter.  Firstly because it's cheap.  I'm beginning to form my own rule of thumb that the cheapest Vietnamese restaurants are usually the best, just as is true for Taquerias, although strangely unrelated.  Secondly this place is tucked away in a semi abandoned, post apocalyptic-esque mall that has certainly seen better days.  Seriously, if you want to have a real life 1st person end of days experience take a stroll around this mall on your way to get a sandwich, it gets real.  True to form for my fantasies about the apocalypse, a Asian market, and a thriving Bánh Mì shop are among the retail establishments holdouts that have survived...thank God.  I could tell this place would be unique and unique is always my favorite flavor.  After visiting I can say Le's does not disappoint and should be on everyone's must try list who lives in or is visiting the Charlotte Area.
     Le's is not visible from the outside at all.  You wanna go to the far end of the mall parking lot, where most cars are likely parked, and enter where it says Dragon Court.  Head towards the dried up fountain and you will see it on your right.  A clean cut little shop enclosed in glass, it's impossible to miss as it's one of the only well kept storefronts in this derelict mall.  Almost immediately after walking in, the man behind the counter asked me if I knew what I wanted, and if it was my first time, I guess it was obvious.  I knew I was getting the #6 Grilled Pork Bánh Mì, which was further confirmed when he suggested trying it, although I'm sure this is the standard newbie/American go to sandwich.  The bread, which for me is basically the most important part of the Bánh Mì, was perfect here.  It has a thick crunchy crust but was still fluffy on the inside.  The grilled pork was not dry at all and had great flavor and texture.  All the veggies that come with the sandwich were in perfect proportion to balance the overall flavor.  Next time I'd probably get the #7, but I just can't pass on some good pork.  Vietnamese places do grilled Pork better than just about any other cuisine I know, and Le's grilled Pork is top notch, you just can't go wrong with it.
     I loved this place, I cannot think of anywhere else like it.  The dilapidated mall itself is worth checking out.  When I was there, a alarm was beeping incessantly, most store fronts were covered in brown paper, and/or fliers and posters, or filled with boxes...or shopping carts with random things in them.  Out of all this Le's stands out as some sort of delicious clean oasis that people constantly steam into and out of.  I'm always more concerned with the taste and execution of food than the atmosphere of a place.  Even though the atmosphere at the mall here is super sketchy and divey, I feel like that actually adds to how awesome Le's is.  On Top of the food being solid and the staff being super efficient and professional,  it's an experience to go here, and a experience just as memorable and exciting as the food is.  It's a true hidden gem, and visiting just makes you feel like your in on some incredible secret.  Fair warning though it does stay busy, seating is extremely limited, and it's cash only, so come prepared.

First of all, believe everyone when they said this place is sketchy..it is. The parking lot is horrible and the area is a little worn down. Not that I felt unsafe, but there was homeless people around including one guy talking to himself in he parking lot lol. Ok so this is like a Asian mini mall and you have to walk somewhat inside to find this place. The place itself is clean with a 98 score. 
I never had this type of food so I didn't know what to expect. I got the #1 combination since reviews said it was good along with a mango bubble tea(with gummies). 
The sandwich itself was for the most part good. I really didn't pay attention to what I was eating though. Nets started flying around us as we were eating so we decided to finish it in the car. Once in the car I examined what I was eating and had no idea!!! Lol. All the meat just looked gross and there was some type of mixture on the bottom of the sandwich that I couldn't make out. Now I love trying new and different types of food but it was a little weird and I ruined for myself and couldn't finish it.
I think I will go back and try something specific like the pork.

Hidden gem. Always friendly and fast! 

Be warned about the parking lot attached to it, it's full of pot holes. My boyfriend and I literally have to plan which car to take if we're going.

Super shady parking lot and strip mall area but worth it for their Yummarama sandwiches. I always order 2 bahn mi sandwiches (I don't get down here often so I need my fix).  I get a #2 and #6 and they never disappoint. 

I was excited that pho ginseng restaurant (Vietnamese) opened in my area and just tried it for the first time. They had a bahn mi pork and chicken sandwich on their menu. I got the pork and it was fine but not even close to as good as le's.

This place was aight. This joint is like classic Bahn Mi. I can see how spots like Crispy Bahn Mi and Bahn Mi Brothers jazz up their sandwiches a bit more. I'm used to those flavors. 

The Pork was okay. I'm not used to woogly fat on my Pork so I wasn't feeling that and the chicken joint was okay. I could barely taste the mayo. My homie noticed the mayo on his sandwich towards the end of his second sandwich. Plus it looks like the mayo sauce was sitting out for a while. 

I added some siracha and hoisin sauce and it still made it just aight. Iono, it's not a spot I would come to again but I'm glad I tried it. 

It's a cute joint tho. The customer service was good. There aren't a billion options to choose from, so it's good they specialize in only a few sandwiches. I think they should work on developing the flavors of their meat a little more. But then again if it ain't broke, don't fix it.

I'm in love with this place. I just need to man up. Have a little prep talk with my lady aka my SUV before we head to Le's. Horrible parking lot. So many pot holes. Your car will so mad at you if you go but it's soo worth it. 
This place is a gem. The gentleman working behind the counter was so patient with me while he tried to understand my broken Vietnamese and English. I was trying to describe to him what my mom ordered every time she's comes here. Simple deli meats with fresh cilantro and pickle carrots, butter/mayo sitting in a nice slightly toasted French baguette. Omg. I'm in heaven. The sandwich only costed me $3.29. I was soo shock I added a soy milk and iced French coffee mixed w.condensed milk.. I know it's a weird combination... But try it... I will never order another sub from Subway as long as this place is open... But remember if you want to try this place out.. BRING CASH!! They don't accept credit...

I found Le's on Yelp* while looking for little gems to eat along N. Tryon Street--and there are plenty, too!  Le's Sandwich & Cafe is buried behind the Asian Corner Mall on Sugar Creek and N Tryon.  You'll know you're there 'cause the building looks like a bomb shelter (the driveway looks like it was hit in several places, too--seriously--you can lose a fender from your car in some of those potholes)!  However, Le's is a great little place for some freshly made, Korean-style banh mi sandwiches all at great prices.  I love the contrast of the soft toasted roll, the warm and spicy meat, the chill of the expertly cut veggies, and especially--the crunch.  Mmmm!

They offer about 8 different riffs on the same item, so my tip is to order #1 and work your way up to #8 as you return.  It's loads of fun, the staff will help with your order, and if you're lucky, find a seat at one of only a handful of tables.  CASH ONLY (and no ATM's in sight).

Was craving a Vietnamese sandwich so did a yelp search and decided to hit up Le's. As we pulled up into the Plaza, a part of me wanted to leave because the parking lot was filled w pot holes and trash and the plaza was not in the best of shape. But we decided to check it out anyways. When we walked into the Plaza - there was a line for Le's Vietnamese sandwich. When we saw that line we knew it would be good. We ordered the combination #1 and grilled pork #6 and they did not disappoint. The combo was. $3.75 - it was amazing and affordable which is why I give this spot 5 stars. Good food and great value

#11 (w/jalapeños!) is the best sandwich I've ever eaten, hands down! 
GO NOWWWWWWWWWW
Best place in Charlotte for Banh Mi for best bang for the buck. When you come here you gotta get alot of banh mi for the family. Make sure to bring cash since card is not accepted

Hard to find but once I read the reviews on Yelp I figured it out. Creepy mall entrance but Le's is very clean and the service is extremely friendly. One bahn mi sandwich was $4 and VERY worth it. Fresh and delicious! Would definitely come here again...not alone though lol

I  ordered #6 for *years* and tried most other sandwiches on Le's board until I finally stretched this year and tried the two I wasn't sure I would like... Firstly #3. the meatball.  It is honestly the most amazing meatball sandwich to exist in the history of meatball sandwiches if you love Le's. I avoided it for years because I thought it would be the meatballs that were served in most Pho. Dense, chewy, thick.  How wrong I was in finally tasting the softest decadent delicious banh mi meatballs.  

Well. I stepped out of my comfort box and secondly tried #9.  I grew up in a family that ate anchovies and sardines and I *hated* it.  Feared the salted critters.  However...I have loved Le's and for years and I told myself one day I will try #9. Today I did.
It was amazing...I hate to say the most amazing tuna sandwich ever for a comparison but truly the most amazing tuna sandwich ever.. take what you think about an american "tuna" but not slathered in mayo and add cilantro, jalapeños and pickled carrots with a beautiful crusty baguette.

Why buy just one? After years of hearing about Le's, I finally made a stop. Thankfully Yelpers are great about directions because there is nothing on the outside of the mall that indicates its existence. 

It's in the mall, go down main hallway, turn right.

There's only one, maybe two tables. Most people just get sandwiches to go. If you're really in a hurry there are bags of sandwiches in the refrigerators to the side. 

Like others warned, bring cash only. I live in a world of plastic, so you know I went to a great deal of preparation to try a Bahn Mi. I wish they'd open a location closer to me; I'd be a regular if that we're the case. Delicious and light on the pocket book. My two faves.
Delicious but cash only and closed on Wednesday. Ditto to what everyone has said in here. Fast service! Loyal customer even though the place is pretty scary. Best sandwiches.

I've recently been craving some banh mi and actually tried to make them at home, but it was way too much work!  So thankfully I was in the Charlotte area and decide to see where I might be able to get some.  Thankfully Le's showed up on Yelp search so she was bookmarked for some future eats.  

After a conference I headed over to Le's which is located in a gritty, seedy, Asian mall which re-defines the term, low-rent.  Funny, but there's an Asian market JUST like this up in Raleigh so I felt right at home.  Inside, Le's has a small store-front, short menu and they serve their sandwiches in short and long rolls.  I go for a meatball and roast pork in a long bun which to me is more VN tradition.  The sandwiches are made fresh and took 10 minutes or so.  I get a small bag with my sammiches and I'm off.  Didn't get to eat them until after they cooled down but loved the light bread, Le's stuffs their sandwiches with lots of carrot, daikon and cilantro, yum.  And the meat was well-done, not stuffed with meat but enough to make for a balanced sandwich.  So rock on Le's!  If you're willing to brave their dingy location, it's well worth the trip for their tasty banh mi.

The parking lot blah, blah, blah. The location blah, blah, blah. Get over yourselves and realize its the BEST SANDWICH in Charlotte. The service is always spectacular and the Banh Mi is off the wall good, and for the price, it cannot be beat. If you don't crave these sandwiches, you may want to have your head checked. Keep up the great work.

Cash only.  Always remember that!  So...Yes, as you drive into the parking lot the first time you think "this can't be right".  As you walk into the building for the first time, you think "this can't be safe".  And when you bite into one of these sandwiches for the first time, you think "Damn, that's a delicious sandwich!" Kara and I love this place. If you haven't tried it, do! And bring cash!

My husband and I live just about a mile away from Le's and I don't think this is a coincidence, a higher power put is in that house knowing that one day we would find this hole in the wall and become dependent on it.

I've tried just about every single sandwich on the board, but my go-to is the number 6 grilled pork sandwich. This place is simple, cheap and delicious and the owners are very friendly. I think the 8" is about $3.50 and the 12" is $4, really can't beat that. They have Sriracha up by the bar too, adding that not only adds a little bit of spice, but also moistens the sandwich. All sandwiches come with mayo, jalapeño slices, cilantro, carrots, and cucumber on the typical french baguette style Banh Mi bread. The bread absolutely makes the sandwich, it's crunch on the outside and fluffy on the inside and is the perfect delivery vehicle for the ingredients inside.

Aside from the sandwiches, the sunflower cookies are completely addicting and a complete steal at $1.75 a pack, they are unlike any cookie I've ever had before, kind of like a cross between a fortune cookie and a funnel cake... I also LOVE their Vietnamese iced coffee and think it's some of the best in Charlotte. The final item that we're completely addicted to is the creamed corn pudding type dessert that comes in a clear plastic cup and is kept in the refrigerator to the right of the door. Do not be intimidated by it, it is rich, yet refreshing at the same time and a very popular summer treat in Vietnam. It has creamed corn on the bottom and some sort of sweet cream on top, maybe with coconut milk, you mix it all together and it is the perfect treat after one of their famous Banh Mis!

If you have an SUV, drive that, because the pavement in the Asian Corner Mall is a disaster, and even with an SUV you have to be very careful. There are 2 identical entrances to the mall, you want to go in the one that says "Dragon Court" on the top, go down the hall and take the 1st right and you'll run right into Le's!

The best banh mi we've had in trying a half-dozen places throughout North Carolina! In fact, I'm not sure I've had better in my travels in Vietnam. Banh mi (pronounced something like 'bang me' in English, not 'bahn me') is French-Vietnamese fusion cuisine - French bread  (banh mi literally means bread made of wheat) made into a sandwich with various meats, coriander leaves, and Vietnamese pickles. This restaurant is very basic - limited seating and nothing fancy - and in a very run-down, almost abandoned looking shopping center, but well worth a visit!
It's really good! I'm so glad this place exists in Charlotte. I get extra veggies and the grilled pork every time. Delish! Try it!

Banh Mi!!! I was so ecstatic to find some place serving that was rated decently I almost went 40 over on the freeway.. I love Banh Mi and have been blessed to have some really good viet sandwich shops in Houston for majority of my life. That being said, my expectation for this place was way too high, to a point I might be underrating it by a star.

- Location
Unless you've been to some Chinatown places the location may or may not freak you out a bit. In like a "I Am Legend" sort of way the shop is located inside a deserted Viet mall which has a equally deserted parking lot. You have to go look for it which may actually deter quite a few people, but inside its pretty much as fast food as you can get. Limited seating space with quick sandwiches.

- The Banh Mi
I'll just break it down simply:
- Bread is not nearly as crisp as it should be (honestly I don't even think its a French Baguette)
- Meat is just not tender and it seems to have been sitting there for ages (rubbery).
- The veggies they put in are fresh, which is good.
- THEY DONT HAVE EGG :( - This really put me over the edge because any good Banh Mi has a fried egg in it.

All of that while only being able to pay cash really just makes this place fall short. If you've never had a banh mi or don't have it often, you'll most likely like this place. For those of us who have  been cultured, it's just not acceptable.

After navigating the treacherous parking lot and the creepy "abandoned mall" feeling hallway you will see the giant line out the door right away.

I've never eaten anywhere else in the Asian Market but I plan too as there looked to be several interesting options.
